intro: Anticharis somalensis, commonly known as the Somali anticharis, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
